results.title: Middle distance swimmers
results.creator_credit: Rick Pepin, Dan Ryan and Aquaforum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “1976-1980 Olympic & world class swimmers”.
The techniques and training of middle distance swimming is shown, including slow motion footage of champion swimmers.

results.title: Middle distance running; hurdling; the sprint
results.creator_credit: Brian Clarkson, Alan Smith and Queensland. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: Middle-distance running” is designed to motivate the young to run, with emphasis on a training program that won’t burn the young athlete out. “Hurdling’ and “The Sprint” present a guide to correct technique, and training routines designed to reinforce these skills.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Clarkson, Alan Smith and Queensland. Dept. of Education

results.title: Midas [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Niki Bern, Isabel Perez and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The classic children’s story of King Midas is retold from the perspective of an adult narrator, with live action and special effects set against a fantastic picture book background. The narrator gets to the heart of the story, revealing the practicalities and dark undertones of being the man with the golden touch. Cast includes Jason Chatwin (King Midas) and Hanna Colles (the Princess).

results.title: Midas
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Isabel Perez and Niki Bern
results.brief_description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.

results.title: Midaq Alley = El Callejon de los Milagros
results.creator_credit: Jorge Fons, Alfredo Ripstein Jr, Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografia and Alameda Films
results.brief_description: Set in a poor section of downtown Mexico City, “Midaq Alley” is a story of several characters, each with their own story to tell, and each bound together inextricably by their inhabitance of this rather rundown derelict neighbourhood. The film is broken up into four separate tales which all intertwine and connect with each other. The first tale “Rutilio” introduces a middle-aged owner of a small bar in the town. Rutilio (Ernesto Gomez Cruz), estranged from his wife and family is about to embark on an affair, the consequences of which will have a devastating effect on his family particularly his son, Chava. The second tale “Alma” is about a young, beautiful and rather naive girl, Alma (Selma Hayek) who is patiently waiting for the return of her fiance Abel (Bruno Bichir) from the United States. Abel has gone to the States to make money so he can come back and marry Alma. Life however becomes complicated for Alma and feeling lonely and missing Abel, she finds herself attracted to the attentions of the suave but rather unsavoury Jose Luis (Daniel Gimenez Cacho). Her life is about to be changed forever. The third story “Susanita” tells of the spinster landlady of a small apartment block in the neighbourhood who longs for romance in her rather sad and lonely life. Susanita (Margarita Sanz) unwittingly and tragically ends up in a “sham” marriage. “El Regreso” (The Return), the fourth story, ties up all the plot threads of romance, deceit, human frailty, sadness and despair into one final act. Based on the novel by Egyptian writer and Nobel prize winner, Naguib Mahfuz, and winner of 45 international film awards, including Berlin and Chicago, this is a fine film with an excellent supporting cast including Maria Rojo, Delia Casanova, Claudio Obregon, Juan Manuel Bernal.
results.title_for_label: Midaq Alley = El Callejon de los Milagros

results.title: mid90s
results.creator_credit: Waypoint Entertainment, A24, Scott Rudin Productions, Jonah Hill, Lila Yacoub, Ken Kao, Eli Bush and Scott Rudin
results.brief_description: Stevie is a sweet 13-year-old about to explode. His mom is loving and attentive, but a little too forthcoming about her romantic life. His big brother is a taciturn and violent bully. So Stevie searches his working-class Los Angeles suburb for somewhere to belong. He finds it at the Motor Avenue skate shop.

results.title: Microwave Cooking
results.brief_description: Barbara Harris, author of “Let’s cook microwave” shares her comprehensive knowledge of microwave cookery. Learn about carry-over cooking, defrosting and shielding, how to determine cooking times and other useful tips. In the latter part of the video Barbara demonstrates delicious homemade meals that can be made in minutes.

results.title: Microsurgical replantation
results.brief_description: Focuses on microsurgery and the successful “replantation” of fingers and toes with full use and feelings. This program also explains the problems associated with finding the necessary parts (including veins) that are needed for a successful operation. Finally emphasis is made on the need for continued research in the area of microsurgery. Contains some graphic images.

results.title: Microsurgery workshop
results.brief_description: Every year Dr Earl Owen at Sydney’s Prince of Wales Hospital conducts a two day work shop in microsurgery for other interested doctors. The film shows doctors working on models and live patients while Dr Owen explains some operating techniques which he uses particularly in cases of severed fingers.

results.title: Microsoft Word for Windows 2.0. V.1. Introductory skills
results.brief_description: This step-by-step training video, developed by LearnPC, is intended as a basic introduction to word processing using Word for Windows 2.0. Narrated by Sheila Swanson, you’ll learn the basics of Microsoft Windows, how to create and save a document, editing, formatting and printing.
